Robert: thanks, Cham pointed out this mistake to me but I haven't corrected it yet.  Will do before final review and merge.

Ok I ll add it back then. Regards, Seshadri On Jun 7, 2017 11:10 PM, "Ismal Meja" wrote: > *@iemejia* commented on this pull request. > ------------------------------ > > In sdks/java/io/hcatalog/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/ > io/hcatalog/HCatalogIO.java > : > > > + * configProperties.put("hive.metastore.uris","thrift://metastore-host:port"); > + * > + * pipeline > + * .apply(...) > + * .apply(HiveIO.write() > + * .withConfigProperties(configProperties) //mandatory > + * .withTable("employee") //mandatory > + * .withDatabase("default") //optional, assumes default if none specified > + * .withFilter(partitionValues) //optional, > + * should be specified if the table is partitioned > + * .withBatchSize(1024L)) //optional, > + * assumes a default batch size of 1024 if none specified > + * } > + */ > + > +public class HCatalogIO { > > You should put it back, the Experimental annotation means that the IO > public API is still evolving, it is a bit of an unfortunate name. I prefer > that we put this annotation back because this is the first version of the > IO and it is better not to engage with code stability too early, in case we > find (or someone reports) new things that can be improved later on via > breaking changes. > Please change it, I suppose @jkff somehow > forgot this, but we have this annotation at this moment in almost all the > IOs. > > > You are receiving this because you were mentioned. > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub > , or mute > the thread > > . >
R: @jbonofre

Two initial comments:
1. I would like to spend a minute thinking holistically how to add partitioning to BQIO, and mkae sure we are doing so in a consistent way.

2. This PR only affects the streaming branch. All BQIO features need to work on both batch and streaming.
Should we look into adding batch?  This feature is pretty critical for our application, so I assume others face the same issues. We'd like to get this merged with master in one form or another.
@takidau
R: @ssisk
@jkff, please hold on. I found the reason for test case taking such a long time and fixing it. Should be done shortly, I will update once done with that.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/11892238/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/11892238)

Coverage remained the same at 70.578% when pulling **d8d9087877c01f1786271726a541fb3eeda7f939 on kennknowles:DirectRunner-matchers** into **b53e6f0dc91948040364d1e742b023d5a2be8433 on apache:master**.

After looking over the PR, a few more comments:

1. TimePartitioning belongs in TableDestination. Different TableDestinations specify completely different tables - it doesn't make sense to force a global time partitioning on all of them.

2. Yes, we need to plumb this through in batch as well.  You'll need to pass the shortened name through when we patch the table description.

3. We'll want to plumb this through in BigQueryIOTest so we can test the new functionality.
OK, thanks. Please don't squash the new commit with your changes though - I already made my changes in my local repo, so I'll cherrypick your new commit on top of that.
Pausing this, actually. I got to the point where basic pipelines were getting through to the evaluators, but I can still work on a couple more override ports.

Optimized the unit test by marking the embedded service as a static member - https://github.com/seshadri-cr/beam/blob/3c0569f2d7a57dd141225b0ba7c301a9154d0211/sdks/java/io/hcatalog/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/hcatalog/HCatalogIOTest.java#L104, this way it just creates a single instance of the meta store service against which all the testing is done.  

Also added a shutdown step to the meta store service -https://github.com/seshadri-cr/beam/blob/3c0569f2d7a57dd141225b0ba7c301a9154d0211/sdks/java/io/hcatalog/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/hcatalog/EmbeddedMetastoreService.java#L105

After these changes, the testing takes 11-12 seconds in my local machine.

mvn clean verify -Prelease also passes clean in my local (I tried this on a debian-linux box as well and did not see any RAT check failures)
@jkff  comments are addressed.

Failure in Java JDK Version Test - JDK 1.7 happened in downstream project. `runners-flink` built successfully in all three JDK versions.
